item.title: St George’s flags hanging on lampposts, 13th September
item.description:
While I understand that many people may wish to express pride in their national identity, the manner and scale of these displays has caused unease for myself and others in the community. In particular: • The sudden proliferation of flags can feel intimidating, especially in such a concentrated and prominent way. • The St George’s Cross has unfortunately been associated in the past with exclusionary or far-right movements, which heightens the sense of discomfort for some residents. • The use of council/public infrastructure (lampposts, roundabouts, railings) without permission raises safety and regulatory concerns. I would be grateful if the council could: 1. Clarify its policy on unauthorised flag displays on public property. 2. Take steps to ensure that such displays do not make sections of the community feel excluded or unwelcome. 3. Consider promoting more inclusive alternatives (for example, celebrating the borough’s cultural diversity, or approved flag displays on designated days). 4. Take down the flags.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Marion Crescent, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins so residents can’t use, 13th September
item.description:
These two Hackney council bins are always overflowing so that the street residents are unable to dispose of our own rubbish. People are fly tipping in the spot. This is especially worrying because it is across the road from a primary school where kids play

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sigdon Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress dumped in garage block, 13th September
item.description:
On Saturday morning 13/09/25, I found a mattress dumped in front of my garage, obstructing our entrance and exit. It was dumped behind my partners car, which was outside the garage. This has caused an obstruction within the block.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blakeney Road, Beckenham, London

item.title: Abandoned truck in assigned disability bay on Christchurch Way, 13th September
item.description:

item.title: Graffiti sprayed at Abbey Close SW9 by Lansdowne Green UKPC Carpark. The graffiti is offensive., 13th September
item.description:
I like to report graffiti sprayed at Abbey Close SW9. The graffiti is very visible sprayed at the Lansdowne Green UKPC carpark. Some of the graffiti is offensive. It is against a brick wall and corner area. Please can the graffiti be removed. It has been up for approximately five months or more.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Allen Edwards Drive, Stockwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti sprayed on shutter at 296-298 Brixton road SW9 6AG. Also known as Thornton Street., 13th September
item.description:
I like to report graffiti sprayed on a shutter at 296-298 Brixton road SW9 6AG. I have already reported about getting the graffiti removed on several occasions buy yet it still remains The latest reference number I was given was 453353. Please could the graffiti be painted over. The wording is fairly large done against the front and side of the shutter. The graffiti has been up for over a month.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 296-298, Brixton Road, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
